cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 355 miles SW of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast across the Gulf, forecast to make landfall along the Florida Panhandle tonight, then track quickly across south-central Georgia and the coastal Carolinas before emerging off the North Carolina coast late Sunday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch area not issued for Georgia coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect only from the MS/AL border eastward to Yankeetown, FL on the Gulf Coast; none for GA coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Florida tonight, then southeastern U.S. coast from northeast Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas Saturday–Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (Atlantic Georgia coast not in surge warning, minor 1–2 ft possible)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts possible Saturday with a 29% chance of sustained 34-kt winds; strongest winds expected midday–evening Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge 1–2 ft possible during high tide due to onshore flow
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Saturday could drop 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts, creating ponding and drainage issues at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rain bands, rough seas and elevated wave heights that may halt pilot transfers and cargo operations
